title.narrative: Delivering Emergency Health Services for IDPs and hard to reach communities in Rakhine State, Myanmar Phase II

description.narrative:
1) Improved health service coverage in four IDP camps, 98 hard-to-reach villages, and one urban center in three townships. Key deliverables - 5 mobile health teams visiting IDP camps and communities and staffing a static clinic - Essential medicines distributed to IDPs - Emergency referrals supported for IDPs and hard-to-reach villages - Over 45,000 community members have access to medical services
2) Implement immunization and nutrition campaigns in four IDP camps and 98 hard-to-reach villages Key deliverables - At least two visits to each hard-to-reach village and IDP camps for immunization and nutrition campaigns - 4,700 children receiving nutritional supplements - 150 pregnant and lactating IDPs receiving nutritional supplements - 11,000 children under 5 years old receiving routine immunizations (five-in-one pentavalent vaccine and measles)
3) Promote health-seeking behavior in four IDP camps and in 98 hard-to-reach villages Key deliverables - 100 health education sessions provided by Basic Health Services (BHS), volunteer health workers and RI staff - IEC materials produced and distributed in IDP camps and villages
4) Expected Results: - 5,253 vulnerable IDPs with access to life-saving medical services, medicines and emergency referrals - 98 poor and marginalized communities in 3 townships with access to emergency referrals - Reduced child mortality and morbidity in target communities - Over 45,000 community members reached with health education messages - Improved health-seeking behavior among the target communities
To improve access to life-saving interventions and preventative care/education for IDPs and hard-to-reach communities. This project is a continuation of aid given to the same region previously.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
